intro: Cyclophorus intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers, which typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively obscure compared to other members of its family.
